is in Iwakuni. The bridge crosses the Nishiki River in Yamaguchi Prefecture, Japan.
History.
The Kintai Bridge was built in 1673. It has five wooden arches at the base of Mount Yokoyama.
The bridge was eclared a National Treasure in 1922.
Kikkou Park, which includes the bridge and Iwakuni Castle, is a popular tourist destinations.
In 2009, the Kintai Bridge was recognized as one of the 100 Landscapes of Japan which best show contemporary Japan and its culture in the Heisei period.
